private_information: I may move disks A B C D
I can only move the topmost disk on a peg when it is one of A B C or D
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the global goal configuration is reached by producing an ordered list of primitive moves that only move disks A B C D and respect Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I may move disks E F G
I can only move the topmost disk on a peg when it is one of E F or G
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the global goal configuration is reached by producing an ordered list of primitive moves that only move disks E F G and respect Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I may move disks H I J
I can only move the topmost disk on a peg when it is one of H I or J
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so that the global goal configuration is reached by producing an ordered list of primitive moves that only move disks H I J and respect Tower of Hanoi rules

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move lists and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver that captures the multi-agent constrained Tower of Hanoi instance and leads to the global goal

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right
Disk labels from smallest to largest: A B C D E F G H I J where A is smallest and J is largest
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J
Initial configuration middle peg is empty
Initial configuration right peg is empty
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom: A,B,F,G,H,I,J
Goal configuration middle peg top-to-bottom: C,E
Goal configuration right peg top-to-bottom: D
Rules: only the top disk of any peg can be moved and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
All moves must use peg names left, middle, right and must be primitive moves moving a single disk from one peg to another

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and may only move disks A B C D. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to execute. Each entry must follow the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the public initial and goal configurations. Only include moves that move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one. Use peg names left middle right and only include moves for disks A B C D.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the provided public information about the pegs initial and goal configurations and your private information about which disks you may move. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform to help achieve the global goal while obeying the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not assume control over disks you are not permitted to move.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and may only move disks E F G. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to execute. Each entry must follow the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the public initial and goal configurations. Only include moves that move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one. Use peg names left middle right and only include moves for disks E F G.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the provided public information about the pegs initial and goal configurations and your private information about which disks you may move. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform to help achieve the global goal while obeying the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not assume control over disks you are not permitted to move.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and may only move disks H I J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to execute. Each entry must follow the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the public initial and goal configurations. Only include moves that move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one. Use peg names left middle right and only include moves for disks H I J.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Use the provided public information about the pegs initial and goal configurations and your private information about which disks you may move. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform to help achieve the global goal while obeying the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not assume control over disks you are not permitted to move.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the ordered primitive move lists from the three agents and produce a single consistent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct per agent by prefixing action names or predicates if necessary so that the origin of each action is explicit. The PDDL must model pegs, disks, disk sizes, initial state as given, goal state as given, and agent move capabilities as constraints. Ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You receive three ordered move lists from agents that contain primitive moves in the specified textual format. Verify their consistency with the Tower of Hanoi rules and with each other. If a conflict or missing information appears, reconcile by requesting clarification where necessary or by making the minimal adjustments needed to ensure a valid plan. Then produce a domain and problem pair for FastDownwards that represents the multi-agent constrained Tower of Hanoi instance and that reaches the goal configuration. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
